scenario_text.value:
Look, I really am glad Ryo made it out okay,
but...
...what was with those ghostly hands?

I don’t know... That was the first time I’ve
ever seen them.

I always knew that fog was scary, but I never
thought something like that was in there...

Just the sight of it sent shivers down my
spine. I never want to see that again.

But I guess just by being here, we run the
risk of being attacked by it at any time.

Oh, don’t say that! Isn’t there a chance it
could be some incredibly rare enemy?

It’s possible, but we can’t know that for
sure. We should be prepared for the worst.

Ugh, just the thought of running into that
creepy thing again makes me sick.
Yeah, it’s a really scary thought.

Still, I don’t think we can let that fear get
the better of us.

We still need to find a way back to our
world, not to mention rescue Miu.

We should at least come up with some plan, or
we could get swallowed up just like that.
Yes, you’re right, but...I don’t know.
Urgh, what can we even do?

That radio tower was our only hope, but it
isn’t even functional.

Even so, these weird messages keep coming,
one after another.

Without calling the professor, or having any
adults around, there’s not much we can do.

It doesn’t have to be much, as long as it’s
something.
(What should I say to Aoi and Saki?)
Let’s run from the fog.
Aoi, any thoughts?
Saki, any thoughts?

Here’s my take, for example. We agree that if
the fog shows up we all run.
But, can you really call that a plan?
Well...I guess not. Maybe it’s a dumb idea.

It’s not even that I think it’s dumb, I just
don’t see what it accomplishes.

At least if we all decide to run, it might
mean we don’t freeze up instead.

Maybe we could all just agree to act
together? I feel like that might be safest.
Yeah, I think you’re right.
Aoi, do you have any ideas?
Well...

I’m not sure you could call it a plan, but
what if we all just agreed to act together?
Oh, I like that! Simple and to the point.
Do you have any ideas, Saki?
What? Me?! Uh...

What about like an exorcism? It’s a ghost,
right? Could we banish it with a seance?
Can you banish things with a seance?
Beats me.

Don’t you have to be a priest to do an exorcism
or something?
Don’t ask me.
Yeah, I’m...not so sure of this plan.

I think maybe the safest thing to do at the
end of the day is just agree to act together.
Oh, I like that!

And after all, it was when Ryo and Haru got
cut off from us that they were in danger.

But it was really Kunemon who saved Ryo last
night.

Yeah, all I could do was watch. I’m not sure
it’d be any different next time.

I think it took a lot of courage to do what
Kunemon did.

Yes, I’m sure you’re right. I can’t say for
sure I’d have been able to do the same.

We really did show up in, like, the worst
possible place, didn’t we?

(Looks like they’re both starting to feel
down again. I thought talking helped a bit,)

(but now I don’t even know what to say.
I think I’ll just give them some time.)
*sniff* *sob* I couldn’t stop them.

Hey, don’t be so hard on yourself! There was
nothing you could’ve done.

But I could tell. I knew there was something
wrong with Ryo.
Oh, why couldn’t I help him?
(Sounds like Aoi is blaming herself.)

Yeah, you know how seriously she takes
things. She regrets not doing more.

She’s been crying all morning. It’s been hard
to watch.

(She feels guilty about what happened to Ryo,
probably because she’s so responsible.)

(I think Labramon’s probably right that there
was nothing she could’ve done,)

(but I can also understand how Aoi could feel
regret at not being able to do more.)
(What should I say to Aoi?)
What’s done is done.
We’re all responsible.
It was inevitable.
What’s done is done.

Aoi, I can understand why you’d feel
regretful about not having done more...

But at this point, what’s done is done. It’s
too late to change anything.
Oooh... I... I...
Takuma! Why would you say that?!

Because we need to focus on what we’re going
to do now, not what we should’ve done then.
Yes...you’re right, Takuma, but...
*sob*... *whimper*... *sniff*

(Oh no, I think that came out a little too
harsh.)

It wasn’t just you, Aoi. We all could’ve done
more to help support Ryo.
I mean, I couldn’t do anything either.
Takuma...
Yeah...I think maybe you’re right.

After all, even I didn’t realize Ryo was that
far gone.

So there’s no reason for you to take all the
blame, Aoi.
Takuma, Saki... I... I... *sob*...
Aoi, please! Stop crying like that!

It’s just...you’re both being so thoughtful,
while I...
I’ve only been thinking about myself... *sob*

Aoi, what happened with Ryo was inevitable.
There was nothing we could’ve done.
You shouldn’t blame yourself.
But...how can you say that so easily?
I can’t just get over this like you...

(Well, it’s not like I’m really over it
either.)
Please, Aoi! Cheer up!
I’m the worst... *sob*

(What should I do? I don’t know how to
comfort her.)

(And if I can’t get everyone to the cafeteria
soon, Kaito could go off on his own!)
Man...I don’t know what to do.

Some good you are at making people feel
better.
Aoi still won’t stop crying.

Yeah...sorry. I couldn’t think of the right
thing to say.

Well, I doubt there’s anything you could say
that’d get through to her right now.
What makes you say that?

Because I don’t think Aoi’s looking for
someone to say the “right thing.”
(Huh? What’s that supposed to mean?)

(Is this a girl thing, or is Saki speaking
from her own experience?)

(Either way, Saki sure does show a lot of
consideration for someone so free-spirited.)
(What should I say to Saki?)
You really get girls.
You’re so considerate.
Have you had it rough?

It’s really impressive how well you
understand the way girls feel about things.

Wow, rude! You make it sound like I’m not
a girl.
You’re a very cute girl, Saki!
Oh, no, I didn’t mean it like that!

I was just thinking there are some things
I don’t really get because I’m a boy.

I didn’t think you cared what other people
thought, but you sure pay close attention.

You think so? I feel like this is pretty
normal.

I don’t know. Look at how you’re thinking of
Aoi, even after everything that happened.
Yeah, he’s right!

Maybe it’s just when I see someone who’s sad
it helps me realize I need to stay calm.
If you say so.

Somehow, I get the impression you’ve been
through a lot.
You...you do?
Why do you say that?

Oh, I just thought maybe you were speaking
from experience just now.
Well...

Uh, of course I was. I’m pretty shocked about
losing Ryo myself, you know?
Saki...
(Oh, yeah. I guess that’s true.)
Anyway, I’ll stay here with Aoi.
Let me handle this.
Labramon and I will be here too!
Oh, okay.
It’s all right, Aoi. Dry those tears.
Saki... I...

It wasn’t your fault, Aoi. You didn’t do
anything wrong.
But...

There was nothing anyone could have done back
there. I wanted to help too. We all did.

It’s nice that the girls can comfort each
other like this.
I’m really glad Saki is here right now.
This place is just awful, isn’t it?

It is, but...we’ll just have to keep going
somehow.

(They’re still upset, but they’re comforting
each other. That’s a good sign.)

I...I couldn’t do anything. I couldn’t stop
Ryo...
It’s okay. Really, it wasn’t your fault.

(I’m worried about Aoi, but it looks like
Saki has this covered.)
